New Records: The Blue Jays set a record for their largest shutout victory in franchise history with a 15-0 rout.
Key Match Events: Daulton Varsho, Spencer Horwitz, Addison Barger, and Will Wagner all homered for the Blue Jays.
The Blue Jays scored seven runs in the first inning on their way to setting a new season high in runs.
Will Wagner went on to record a five-hit night, becoming the first Blue Jays rookie to do so.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Zebby Matthews made just his fourth Major League start, and while he gave up five earned runs across his first three, the Blue Jays tagged him for nine runs -- all earned -- in just two innings on Saturday.
Others: José Berríos (14-9) pitched six scoreless innings.
Nathan Lukes, who had himself a four-hit night in just his second game of the season, came on to tack on three more runs in the eighth and ninth innings.
